text: Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a declaration of those things which are most surely believed among us,
speaker: Narrator

text: even as they were delivered unto us by those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and ministers of the Word,
speaker: Narrator

text: it seemed good to me also, having had perfect understanding of things from the very first, to write unto thee in order, most excellent Theophilus,
speaker: Narrator

text: that thou mightest know the certainty of those things wherein thou hast been instructed.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the priestly course of Abijah; and his wife was of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were both righteous before God, walking blameless in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they had no child because Elizabeth was barren, and they both were now well stricken in years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that while he executed the priest’s office before God in the order of his course,
speaker: Narrator

text: according to the custom of the priest’s office, his lot was to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the whole multitude of the people were praying outside at the time of incense.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there appeared unto him an angel of the Lord, standing on the right side of the altar of incense.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Zacharias saw him he was troubled, and fear fell upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the angel said unto him, “Fear not, Zacharias, for thy prayer is heard, and thy wife Elizabeth shall bear thee a son, and thou shalt call his name John.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt have joy and gladness, and many shall rejoice at his birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he shall be great in the sight of the Lord, and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink, and he shall be filled with the Holy Ghost even from his mother’s womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many of the children of Israel shall he turn to the Lord their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall go before Him in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just, to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zacharias said unto the angel, “Whereby shall I know this? For I am an old man, and my wife well stricken in years.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel answering said unto him, “I am Gabriel who stands in the presence of God, and am sent to speak unto thee and to show thee these glad tidings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, thou shalt be dumb and not able to speak until the day that these things shall be performed, because thou believest not my words which shall be fulfilled in their season.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people waited for Zacharias, and marveled that he tarried so long in the temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he came out, he could not speak unto them, and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple; for he beckoned unto them and remained speechless.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that as soon as the days of his ministration were accomplished, he departed to his own house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after those days his wife Elizabeth conceived, and hid herself five months, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Thus hath the Lord dealt with me in the days wherein He looked on me, to take away my reproach among men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God unto a city of Galilee, named Nazareth,
speaker: Narrator

text: to a virgin espoused to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David; and the virgin’s name was Mary.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel came in unto her and said, “Hail, thou that art highly favored, the Lord is with thee; blessed art thou among women.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when she saw him, she was troubled at his saying and cast about in her mind what manner of salutation this should be.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel said unto her, “Fear not, Mary, for thou hast found favor with God.
speaker: Jesus

text: And behold, thou shalt conceive in thy womb and bring forth a Son, and shalt call His name Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall be great and shall be called the Son of the Highest; and the Lord God shall give unto Him the throne of His father David,
speaker: Jesus

text: and He shall reign over the house of Jacob for ever; and of His Kingdom there shall be no end.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Mary unto the angel, “How shall this be, seeing I know not a man?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel answered and said unto her, “The Holy Ghost shall come upon thee, and the power of the Highest shall overshadow thee. Therefore also that Holy Being who shall be born of thee shall be called the Son of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: And behold, thy cousin Elizabeth: she hath also conceived a son in her old age, and this is the sixth month with her, who was called barren.
speaker: Narrator

text: For with God nothing shall be impossible.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mary said, “Behold the handmaid of the Lord; be it unto me according to thy word.” And the angel departed from her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mary arose in those days and went into the hill country with haste, into a city of Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and entered into the house of Zacharias and saluted Elizabeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, when Elizabeth heard the salutation of Mary, that the babe leaped in her womb, and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Ghost.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she spoke out with a loud voice and said, “Blessed art thou among women, and blessed is the fruit of thy womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And why is it granted to me that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
speaker: Narrator

text: For lo, as soon as the voice of thy salutation sounded in mine ears, the babe leaped in my womb for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And blessed is she that believed; for there shall be a fulfillment of those things which were told her from the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mary said, “My soul doth magnify the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: and my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Savior.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He hath regarded the low estate of His handmaiden; for behold, from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He that is mighty hath done to me great things, and holy is His name.
speaker: Narrator

text: And His mercy is on them that fear Him, from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath shown strength with His arm; He hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath put down the mighty from their seats, and exalted them of low degree.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath filled the hungry with good things, and the rich He hath sent empty away.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hath helped His servant Israel, in remembrance of His mercy,
speaker: Narrator

text: as He spoke to our fathers, to Abraham and to his seed for ever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mary abode with her about three months, and returned to her own house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Elizabeth’s full time came that she should be delivered, and she brought forth a son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And her neighbors and her kindred heard how the Lord had shown great mercy upon her, and they rejoiced with her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child, and they called him Zacharias, after the name of his father.
speaker: Narrator

text: But his mother answered and said, “Not so, but he shall be called John.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto her, “There is none of thy kindred that is called by this name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made signs to his father, how he would have him called.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he asked for a writing tablet and wrote, saying, “His name is John.” And they marveled all.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue loosed, and he spoke and praised God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And fear came on all who dwelt round about them; and all these sayings were noised abroad throughout all the hill country of Judea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all those who heard them laid them up in their hearts, saying, “What manner of child shall this be?” And the hand of the Lord was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Ghost and prophesied, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, for He hath visited and redeemed His people,
speaker: Narrator

text: and hath raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of His servant David.
speaker: Narrator

text: As He spoke by the mouth of His holy prophets, who have been since the world began,
speaker: Narrator

text: that we should be saved from our enemies and from the hand of all that hate us,
speaker: Narrator

text: to perform the mercy promised to our fathers and to remember His holy covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text: the oath which He swore to our father Abraham:
speaker: Narrator

text: that He would grant unto us that we, being delivered out of the hand of our enemies, might serve Him without fear,
speaker: Narrator

text: in holiness and righteousness before Him all the days of our life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou, child, shalt be called the prophet of the Highest; for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare His ways,
speaker: Narrator

text: to give knowledge of salvation unto His people by the remission of their sins,
speaker: Narrator

text: through the tender mercy of our God, whereby the Dayspring from on high hath visited us,
speaker: Narrator

text: to give light to them that sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, to guide our feet into the way of peace.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the child grew and waxed strong in spirit, and was in the deserts until the day of his appearing unto Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in those days that there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be taxed.
speaker: Narrator

text: (And this taxing was first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And all went to be taxed, every one into his own city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph also went up from Galilee out of the city of Nazareth into Judea, unto the City of David which is called Bethlehem (because he was of the house and lineage of David)
speaker: Narrator

text: to be taxed with Mary, his espoused wife, who was great with child.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so it was that while they were there, the days were accomplished that she should be delivered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she brought forth her firstborn Son, and wrapped Him in swaddling clothes and laid Him in a manger, because there was no room for them in the inn.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field, keeping watch over their flock by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: And lo, the angel of the Lord came upon them, and the glory of the Lord shone round about them, and they were sore afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel said unto them, “Fear not, for behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy, which shall be to all people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For unto you is born this day in the City of David a Savior, who is Christ the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this shall be a sign unto you: Ye shall find the Babe wrapped in swaddling clothes, lying in a manger.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God and saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good will toward men!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, when the angels were gone away from them into heaven, the shepherds said one to another, “Let us now go even unto Bethlehem and see this thing which has come to pass, which the Lord hath made known unto us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came with haste and found Mary and Joseph, and the Babe lying in a manger.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had seen it, they made known abroad the saying which was told them concerning this Child.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all those who heard it wondered at those things which were told them by the shepherds.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Mary kept all these things and pondered them in her heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, as it was told unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when eight days were accomplished for the circumcising of the Child, His name was called Jesus, who was so named by the angel before He was conceived in the womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the days of her purification according to the Law of Moses were accomplished, they brought Him to Jerusalem to present Him to the Lord
speaker: Narrator

text: (as it is written in the law of the Lord: “Every male that openeth the womb shall be called holy to the Lord”),
speaker: Narrator

text: and to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord: “A pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon, and the same man was just and devout, waiting for the consolation of Israel; and the Holy Ghost was upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was revealed unto him by the Holy Ghost that he should not see death before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he came by the Spirit into the temple; and when the parents brought in the child Jesus to do for Him after the custom of the law,
speaker: Narrator

text: then he took Him up in his arms, and blessed God and said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Lord, now lettest Thou Thy servant depart in peace, according to Thy word;
speaker: Narrator

text: for mine eyes have seen Thy salvation,
speaker: Narrator

text: which Thou hast prepared before the face of all people,
speaker: Narrator

text: a light to lighten the Gentiles, and the glory of Thy people Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph and His mother marveled at those things which were spoken of Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Simeon blessed them and said unto Mary His mother, “Behold, this Child is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel, and for a sign which shall be spoken against
speaker: Narrator

text: (yea, a sword shall pierce through thy own soul also), that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel of the tribe of Asher. She was of great age and had lived with a husband seven years from her virginity,
speaker: Narrator

text: and she was a widow of about fourscore and four years. She departed not from the temple, but served God with fastings and prayers night and day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she, coming in that instant, gave thanks likewise unto the Lord, and spoke of Him to all those who looked for redemption in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee to their own city, Nazareth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Child grew and waxed strong in spirit, filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was upon Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now His parents went to Jerusalem every year at the Feast of the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem according to the custom of the Feast.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had fulfilled the days, as they returned, the child Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem; and Joseph and His mother knew not of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they, supposing Him to have been in the company, went a day’s journey; and they sought Him among their kinsfolk and acquaintances.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they found Him not, they turned back again to Jerusalem, seeking Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that after three days they found Him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the doctors, both hearing them and asking them questions.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all who heard Him were astonished at His understanding and answers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they saw Him they were amazed, and His mother said unto Him, “Son, why hast Thou thus dealt with us? Behold, Thy father and I have sought Thee sorrowing.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “How is it that ye sought Me? Knew ye not that I must be about My Father’s business?”
speaker: Jesus

text: And they understood not the saying which He spoke unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He went down with them and came to Nazareth, and was subject unto them. But His mother kept all these things in her heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of Iturea and of the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias the tetrarch of Abilene,
speaker: Narrator

text: Annas and Caiaphas being the high priests, the Word of God came unto John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he came into all the country about the Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins,
speaker: Narrator

text: as it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet, saying, “The voice of one crying in the wilderness: ‘Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make His paths straight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every valley shall be filled, and every mountain and hill shall be brought low; and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough ways shall be made smooth;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all flesh shall see the salvation of God.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said he to the multitude who came forth to be baptized by him, “O generation of vipers! Who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance, and begin not to say among yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I say unto you, that God is able from these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now also the ax is laid unto the root of the trees. Every tree therefore which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down and cast into the fire.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people asked him, saying, “What shall we do then?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered and said unto them, “He that hath two coats, let him impart to him that hath none. And he that hath meat, let him do likewise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came also publicans to be baptized, and said unto him, “Master, what shall we do?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, “Exact no more than that which is appointed you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the soldiers likewise demanded of him, saying, “And what shall we do?” And he said unto them, “Do violence to no man, neither accuse any falsely; and be content with your wages.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And as the people were in expectation, and all men mused in their hearts whether John was the Christ or not,
speaker: Narrator

text: John answered, saying unto them all, “I indeed baptize you with water; but One mightier than I cometh, the straps of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose. He shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: His winnowing fan is in His hand, and He will thoroughly purge His floor and will gather the wheat into His garner; but the chaff He will burn with fire unquenchable.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And with many other exhortations preached he unto the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him because of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, and for all the evils which Herod had done,
speaker: Narrator

text: added yet this above all, that he shut up John in prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when all the people were baptized, it came to pass that Jesus also was baptized. And while He prayed the heaven was opened,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily shape like a dove upon Him, and a voice came from Heaven, which said, “Thou Art My Beloved Son; In Thee I Am Well Pleased.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus Himself had become about thirty years of age, being (as was supposed) the son of Joseph, who was the son of Heli,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was the son of Matthat, who was the son of Levi, who was the son of Melchi, who was the son of Janna, who was the son of Joseph,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was the son of Mattathias, who was the son of Amos, who was the son of Nahum, who was the son of Esli, who was the son of Naggai,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was the son of Maath, who was the son of Mattathias, who was the son of Semei, who was the son of Joseph, who was the son of Juda,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was the son of Joanna, who was the son of Rhesa, who was the son of Zerubbabel, who was the son of Shealtiel, who was the son of Neri,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was the son of Melchi, who was the son of Addi, who was the son of Cosam, who was the son of Elmodam, who was the son of Er,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was the son of Jose, who was the son of Eliezer, who was the son of Jorim, who was the son of Matthat, who was the son of Levi,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was the son of Simeon, who was the son of Judah, who was the son of Joseph, who was the son of Jonan, who was the son of Eliakim,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was the son of Melea, who was the son of Menan, who was the son of Mattatha, who was the son of Nathan, who was the son of David,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was the son of Jesse, who was the son of Obed, who was the son of Boaz, who was the son of Salmon, who was the son of Nahshon,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was the son of Amminadab, who was the son of Aram, who was the son of Hezron, who was the son of Perez, who was the son of Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was the son of Jacob, who was the son of Isaac, who was the son of Abraham, who was the son of Terah, who was the son of Nahor,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was the son of Serug, who was the son of Reu, who was the son of Peleg, who was the son of Eber, who was the son of Shelah,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was the son of Cainan, who was the son of Arphaxad, who was the son of Shem, who was the son of Noah, who was the son of Lamech,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was the son of Methuselah, who was the son of Enoch, who was the son of Jared, who was the son of Mahalaleel, who was the son of Cainan,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was the son of Enos, who was the son of Seth, who was the son of Adam, who was the son of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus, being full of the Holy Ghost, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for forty days was tempted by the devil. And in those days He ate nothing, and afterward when they were ended, He hungered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the devil said unto Him, “If Thou be the Son of God, command this stone that it be made bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered him, saying, “It is written: ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: And the devil, taking Him up onto a high mountain, showed unto Him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the devil said unto Him, “All this power will I give Thee, and the glory of them; for this has been delivered unto me, and to whomsoever I will, I give it.
speaker: Narrator

text: If Thou therefore wilt worship me, all shall be Thine.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered and said unto him, “Get thee behind Me, Satan! For it is written: ‘Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and Him only shalt thou serve.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: And he brought Him to Jerusalem, and set Him on a pinnacle of the temple and said unto Him, “If Thou be the Son of God, cast Thyself down from hence.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is written: ‘He shall give His angels charge over thee to keep thee,’
speaker: Narrator

text: and, ‘In their hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answering said unto him, “It is said, ‘Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: And when the devil had ended all the temptation, he departed from Him for a season.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee, and His fame went out through all the region round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He taught in their synagogues, being glorified by all.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came to Nazareth where He had been brought up. And as His custom was, He went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day and stood up to read.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was delivered unto Him the book of the prophet Isaiah. And when He had opened the book, He found the place where it was written:
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Spirit of the Lord is upon Me, because He hath anointed Me to preach the Gospel to the poor. He hath sent Me to heal the brokenhearted, to preach deliverance to the captives, and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty them that are bruised,
speaker: Jesus

text: to preach the acceptable year of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He closed the book, and He gave it again to the minister and sat down. And the eyes of all those who were in the synagogue were fastened on Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He began to say unto them, “This day is this Scripture fulfilled in your ears.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And all bore Him witness and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of His mouth. And they said, “Is not this Joseph’s son?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “Ye will surely say unto Me this proverb: ‘Physician, heal thyself! Whatsoever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in thy country.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: And He said, “Verily I say unto you, no prophet is accepted in his own country.
speaker: Jesus

text: But I tell you in truth, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the heaven was shut up three years and six months, when great famine was throughout all the land.
speaker: Jesus

text: But unto none of them was Elijah sent, save unto Zarephath, a city of Sidon, unto a woman that was a widow.
speaker: Jesus

text: And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, and none of them was cleansed, except Naaman the Syrian.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then all those in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath,
speaker: Jesus

text: and rose up and thrust Him out of the city; and they led Him unto the brow of a hill whereon their city was built, that they might cast Him down headlong.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He, passing through the midst of them, went His way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and taught them on the Sabbath days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were astonished at His doctrine, for His word was with power.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the synagogue there was a man, who had a spirit of an unclean devil, and cried out with a loud voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Let us alone! What have we to do with Thee, Thou Jesus of Nazareth? Art Thou come to destroy us? I know Thee and who Thou art — the Holy One of God!”
speaker: Jesus

text: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Hold thy peace, and come out of him!” And when the devil had thrown him in their midst, he came out of him and hurt him not.
speaker: Jesus

text: And they were all amazed, and spoke among themselves, saying, “What a word is this! For with authority and power he commandeth the unclean spirits, and they come out.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And His fame went out into every place in the country round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He arose out of the synagogue and entered into Simon’s house. And Simon’s wife’s mother was taken with a great fever, and they besought Him for her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He stood over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. And immediately she arose and ministered unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the sun was setting, all those who had any sick with divers diseases brought them unto Him; and He laid His hands on every one of them, and healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And devils also came out of many, crying out and saying, “Thou art Christ, the Son of God!” And He, rebuking them, suffered them not to speak; for they knew that He was Christ.
speaker: Jesus

text: And when it was day, He departed and went into a desert place. And the people sought Him and came unto Him and would have stayed Him, that He should not depart from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said unto them, “I must preach the Kingdom of God to other cities also, for therefore am I sent.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And He preached in the synagogues of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that, as the people pressed upon Him to hear the Word of God, He stood by the Lake of Gennesaret
speaker: Narrator

text: and saw two boats standing by the lake, but the fishermen were gone out of them and were washing their nets.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He entered into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little from the land. And He sat down and taught the people from the boat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when He was through speaking, He said unto Simon, “Launch out into the deep, and let down your nets for a draft.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Simon answering said unto Him, “Master, we have toiled all the night and have taken nothing. Nevertheless, at Thy word I will let down the net.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had done this, they enclosed a great multitude of fishes, and their net began to break.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they beckoned unto their partners, who were in the other boat, that they should come and help them. And they came and filled both the boats, so that they began to sink.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, O Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For he was astonished, and all those who were with him, at the draft of the fishes which they had taken;
speaker: Narrator

text: and so also were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. And Jesus said unto Simon, “Fear not. From henceforth thou shalt catch men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had brought their boats to land, they forsook all and followed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass when He was in a certain city, behold, a man full of leprosy, seeing Jesus, fell on his face and besought Him, saying, “Lord, if Thou wilt, Thou canst make me clean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He put forth His hand and touched him, saying, “I will; be thou clean.” And immediately the leprosy departed from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He charged him to tell no man, but, “Go and show thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing according as Moses commanded, as a testimony unto them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But so much the more His fame spread abroad, and great multitudes came together to hear and to be healed by Him of their infirmities.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He withdrew Himself into the wilderness and prayed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass on a certain day, as He was teaching, that there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by, who had come from every town of Galilee and Judea and Jerusalem. And the power of the Lord was present to heal them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, men brought in on a bed a man who was taken with a palsy, and they sought means to bring him in and to lay him before Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they could not find a way to bring him in because of the multitude, they went upon the housetop, and let him down on his couch through the tiling into the midst before Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He saw their faith, He said unto him, “Man, thy sins are forgiven thee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, “Who is this who speaketh blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Jesus perceived their thoughts, He answering said unto them, “What reason ye in your hearts:
speaker: Narrator

text: whether it is easier to say, ‘Thy sins be forgiven thee,’ or to say, ‘Rise up and walk’?
speaker: Narrator

text: But that ye may know that the Son of Man hath power upon earth to forgive sins,” He said unto the one sick with the palsy, “I say unto thee, arise and take up thy couch and go into thine house.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately he rose up before them, and took up that whereon he lay, and departed to his own house, glorifying God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were all amazed, and they glorified God and were filled with fear, saying, “We have seen strange things today.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And after these things He went forth and saw a publican named Levi, sitting in the customhouse, and He said unto him, “Follow Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he left all, rose up, and followed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Levi made Him a great feast in his own house, and there was a great company of publicans and of others who sat down with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But their scribes and Pharisees murmured against His disciples, saying, “Why do ye eat and drink with publicans and sinners?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answering said unto them, “They that are whole need not a physician, but they that are sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto Him, “Why do the disciples of John fast often and make prayers, and likewise the disciples of the Pharisees, but thine eat and drink?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “Can ye make the attendants of the bridechamber fast while the bridegroom is with them?
speaker: Narrator

text: But the days will come when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He spoke also a parable unto them: “No man putteth a piece of a new garment upon an old; otherwise, both the new maketh a rent, and the piece that was taken out of the new agreeth not with the old.
speaker: Narrator

text: And no man putteth new wine into old wineskins; else the new wine will burst the wineskins and be spilled, and the wineskins shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: But new wine must be put into new wineskins, and both are preserved.
speaker: Narrator

text: No man also, having drunk old wine, straightway desireth new; for he saith, ‘The old is better.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass on the second Sabbath after the first, that He went through the cornfields. And His disciples plucked the ears of corn and, rubbing them in their hands, ate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And certain of the Pharisees said unto them, “Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the Sabbath days?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answering them said, “Have ye not read so much as this, what David did when he himself hungered and they that were with him:
speaker: Narrator

text: how he went into the house of God, and took and ate the showbread and gave also to them that were with him, which it is not lawful to eat except for the priests alone?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “The Son of Man is Lord also of the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass also on another Sabbath, that He entered into the synagogue and taught. And there was a man whose right hand was withered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the scribes and Pharisees watched Him to see whether He would heal on the Sabbath day, that they might find an accusation against Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He knew their thoughts, and said to the man who had the withered hand, “Rise up and stand forth in the midst.” And he arose and stood forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Jesus unto them, “I will ask you one thing: Is it lawful on the Sabbath days to do good, or to do evil? To save life, or to destroy it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And looking round about upon them all, He said unto the man, “Stretch forth thy hand.” And he did so, and his hand was restored whole as the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were filled with madness, and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in those days that He went out onto a mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when it was day, He called unto Him His disciples, and from them He chose twelve, whom also He named apostles:
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon (whom He also named Peter), and Andrew his brother, James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,
speaker: Narrator

text: Matthew and Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon called the Zealot,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Judas the brother of James, and Judas Iscariot who also was the traitor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came down with them and stood on the plain with the company of His disciples and a great multitude of people out of all Judea and Jerusalem, and from the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear Him and to be healed of their diseases,
speaker: Narrator

text: and those who were vexed with unclean spirits; and they were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the whole multitude sought to touch Him, for there went virtue out of Him and healed them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He lifted up His eyes on His disciples and said, “Blessed be ye poor, for yours is the Kingdom of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are ye that hunger now, for ye shall be filled. Blessed are ye that weep now, for ye shall laugh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are ye when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you from their company, and shall reproach you and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of Man’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice ye in that day and leap for joy, for behold, your reward is great in Heaven; for in like manner did their fathers unto the prophets.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But woe unto you that are rich, for ye have received your consolation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto you that are full, for ye shall hunger. Woe unto you that laugh now, for ye shall mourn and weep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto you when all men shall speak well of you, for so did their fathers to the false prophets.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But I say unto you that hear: Love your enemies, do good to them that hate you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless them that curse you, and pray for them that despitefully use you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto him that smiteth thee on the one cheek, offer also the other; and him that taketh away thy cloak, forbid not to take thy coat also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give to every man that asketh of thee; and of him that taketh away thy goods, ask them not back.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if ye love them that love you, what thanks have ye? For sinners also love those that love them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if ye do good to them that do good to you, what thanks have ye? For sinners also do even the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if ye lend to them from whom ye hope to receive, what thanks have ye? For sinners also lend to sinners, to receive as much again.
speaker: Narrator

text: But love ye your enemies, and do good and lend, hoping for nothing in return; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be the children of the Highest; for He is kind unto the unthankful and to the evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be ye therefore merciful, as your Father also is merciful.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Judge not, and ye shall not be judged. Condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned. Forgive, and ye shall be forgiven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give, and it shall be given unto you: good measure, pressed down and shaken together and running over, shall men give into your bosom. For with the same measure that ye mete, therewith it shall be measured to you again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He spoke a parable unto them: “Can the blind lead the blind? Shall they not both fall into the ditch?
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciple is not above his master, but every one that is perfect shall be as his master.
speaker: Narrator

text: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother’s eye, but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or how canst thou say to thy brother, ‘Brother, let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye,’ when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye? Thou hypocrite! Cast out first the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother’s eye.
speaker: Narrator

text: “For a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit; neither doth a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: For every tree is known by his own fruit. For from thorns men do not gather figs, nor from a bramble bush gather they grapes.
speaker: Narrator

text: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is evil; for of the abundance of his heart his mouth speaketh.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And why call ye Me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and do not the things which I say?
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever cometh to Me, and heareth My sayings and doeth them, I will show you to whom he is like:
speaker: Narrator

text: He is like a man who built a house and dug deep and laid the foundation on a rock; and when the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently upon that house and could not shake it, for it was founded upon a rock.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he that heareth, and doeth not, is like a man that built a house without a foundation upon the earth, against which the stream beat vehemently, and immediately it fell. And the ruin of that house was great.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when He had ended all His sayings in the audience of the people, He entered into Capernaum.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a certain centurion’s servant, who was dear unto him, was sick and ready to die.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he heard of Jesus, he sent the elders of the Jews unto Him, beseeching Him that He would come and heal his servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they came to Jesus they besought Him earnestly, saying that the one for whom He should do this was worthy,
speaker: Narrator

text: “for he loveth our nation, and he hath built us a synagogue.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus went with them. And when He was not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to Him, saying unto Him, “Lord, trouble not Thyself, for I am not worthy that Thou shouldest enter under my roof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto Thee. But say the word, and my servant shall be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I also am a man set under authority, having under me soldiers. And I say unto one, ‘Go’, and he goeth; and to another, ‘Come,’ and he cometh; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he doeth it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard these things, He marveled at him, and turned about and said unto the people who followed Him, “I say unto you, I have not found so great a faith, no, not in Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And those who were sent, returning to the house, found the servant whole who had been sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass the day after, that He went into a city called Nain; and many of His disciples went with Him, and many people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when He came nigh to the gate of the city, behold, there was a dead man being carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. And many people of the city were with her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Lord saw her, He had compassion on her and said unto her, “Weep not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came and touched the bier, and those who bore him stood still. And He said, “Young man, I say unto thee, arise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that was dead sat up and began to speak. And He delivered him to his mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there came a fear on all, and they glorified God, saying, “A great prophet is risen up among us”; and, “God hath visited His people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And this report of Him went forth throughout all Judea and throughout all the region round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the disciples of John told him of all these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And John, calling unto him two of his disciples, sent them to Jesus asking, “Art thou He that should come, or look we for another?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the men had come unto Him, they said, “John the Baptist hath sent us unto thee, asking, ‘Art thou He that should come, or look we for another?’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that same hour He cured many of their infirmities and plagues and of evil spirits, and unto many who were blind He gave sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus answering said unto them, “Go your way, and tell John what things ye have seen and heard: how the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, to the poor the Gospel is preached.
speaker: Narrator

text: And blessed is he whosoever shall not be offended in Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the messengers of John had departed, He began to speak unto the people concerning John: “What went ye out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken with the wind?
speaker: Narrator

text: But what went ye out to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they that are gorgeously appareled and live luxuriously are in kings’ courts.
speaker: Narrator

text: But what went ye out to see? A prophet? Yea, I say unto you, and much more than a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is he, of whom it is written: ‘Behold, I send My messenger before Thy face, who shall prepare Thy way before Thee.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For I say unto you, among those that are born of women, there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist; but he that is least in the Kingdom of God is greater than he.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people that heard Him, and the publicans, justified God, being baptized with the baptism of John.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God against themselves, being not baptized by him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said, “Whereunto then shall I liken the men of this generation? And to what are they like?
speaker: Narrator

text: They are like unto children sitting in the marketplace, and calling one to another and saying, ‘We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned to you, and ye have not wept.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and ye say, ‘He hath a devil.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The Son of Man is come eating and drinking, and ye say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners!’
speaker: Narrator

text: But wisdom is justified by all her children.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And one of the Pharisees desired Him that He would eat with him. And He went into the Pharisee’s house and sat down to meat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, a woman in the city, who was a sinner, when she learned that Jesus sat at meat in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster box of ointment,
speaker: Narrator

text: and stood at His feet behind Him weeping; and began to wash His feet with tears and wiped them with the hair of her head, and kissed His feet and anointed them with the ointment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the Pharisee who had bidden Him saw it, he spoke within himself, saying, “This man, if he were a prophet, would have known who and what manner of woman this is who toucheth him, for she is a sinner.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answering said unto him, “Simon, I have something to say unto thee.” And he said, “Master, say on.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “There was a certain creditor that had two debtors. The one owed five hundred pence, and the other fifty.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had nothing to pay, he freely forgave them both. Tell me therefore, which of them will love him most?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon answered and said, “I suppose that he to whom he forgave most. And He said unto him, “Thou hast rightly judged.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He turned to the woman and said unto Simon, “Seest thou this woman? I entered into thine house: Thou gavest Me no water for My feet, but she hath washed My feet with tears and wiped them with the hair of her head.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou gavest Me no kiss, but this woman since the time I came in hath not ceased to kiss My feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: My head with oil thou didst not anoint, but this woman hath anointed My feet with ointment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I say unto thee, her sins, which are many, are forgiven, for she loved much. But to whom little is forgiven, the same loveth little.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto her, “Thy sins are forgiven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And those who sat at meat with Him began to say within themselves, “Who is this that forgiveth sins also?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to the woman, “Thy faith hath saved thee. Go in peace.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass afterward that He went throughout every city and village, preaching and showing the glad tidings of the Kingdom of God. And the twelve were with Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary called Magdalene, out of whom went seven devils,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Joanna the wife of Chuza, Herod’s steward, and Susanna, and many others who ministered unto Him from their substance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when many people had gathered together and had come to Him out of every city, He spoke by a parable:
speaker: Narrator

text: “A sower went out to sow his seed. And as he sowed, some fell by the wayside, and it was trodden down, and the fowls of the air devoured it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some fell upon a rock, and as soon as it had sprung up, it withered away because it lacked moisture.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns sprang up with it and choked it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And other fell on good ground, and sprang up and bore fruit a hundredfold.” And when He had said these things, He cried, “He that hath ears to hear, let him hear!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And His disciples asked Him, saying, “What might this parable mean?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said, “Unto you it is given to know the mysteries of the Kingdom of God; but to others in parables, that ‘seeing they might not see, and hearing they might not understand.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the parable is this: The seed is the Word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those by the wayside are they that hear; then cometh the devil and taketh away the Word out of their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seed on the rock are they that, when they hear, receive the Word with joy, but they have no root: they for a while believe, and in time of temptation fall away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that which fell among thorns are they that, when they have heard, go forth and are choked with cares and riches and pleasures of this life, and bring no fruit to perfection.
speaker: Narrator

text: But that on the good ground are they that, in an honest and good heart, having heard the Word, keep it and bring forth fruit with patience.
speaker: Narrator

text: “No man, when he hath lighted a candle, covereth it with a vessel or putteth it under a bed, but setteth it on a candlestick, that they that enter in may see the light.
speaker: Narrator

text: For nothing is secret that shall not be made manifest; neither any thing hid that shall not be known and come abroad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take heed therefore how ye hear, for whosoever hath, to him shall be given; and whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he seemeth to have.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came to Him His mother and His brethren, and could not come near Him because of the crowd.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told to Him by certain ones, who said, “Thy mother and thy brethren stand outside, desiring to see thee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He answered and said unto them, “My mother and My brethren are these who hear the Word of God, and do it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it came to pass on a certain day, that He went into a boat with His disciples. And He said unto them, “Let us go over unto the other side of the lake.” And they launched forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as they sailed, He fell asleep. And there came down a storm of wind on the lake, and they were filling with water and were in jeopardy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to Him and awoke Him, saying, “Master, Master, we perish!” Then He arose, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water; and they ceased, and there was a calm.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “Where is your faith?” And they being afraid wondered, saying one to another, “What manner of man is this? For He commandeth even the winds and the water, and they obey Him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is opposite Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He went forth to land, there met Him from the city a certain man who had had devils a long time, and wore no clothes, neither abode in any house, but in the tombs.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell down before Him, and with a loud voice said, “What have I to do with Thee, Jesus, Thou Son of God Most High? I beseech Thee, torment me not!”
speaker: Narrator

text: (For He had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For oftentimes it had caught him, and he was kept bound with chains and in fetters; and he broke the bands and was driven by the devil into the wilderness.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus asked him, saying, “What is thy name?” And he said, “Legion,” because many devils had entered into him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they besought Him that He would not command them to go out into the deep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was there a herd of many swine feeding on the mountain. And they besought Him that He would suffer them to enter into them. And He suffered them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then went the devils out of the man and entered into the swine, and the herd ran violently down a steep slope into the lake and were choked.
speaker: Narrator

text: When those who fed them saw what was done, they fled and went and told it in the city and in the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they went out to see what was done. And they came to Jesus, and found the man out of whom the devils had departed, sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed, and in his right mind. And they were afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those also who had seen it told them by what means he that had been possessed by the devils was healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the whole multitude of the country of the Gadarenes and round about besought Him to depart from them, for they were taken with great fear. And He went up into the boat, and returned back again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the man out of whom the devils had departed besought Him that he might be with Him. But Jesus sent him away, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Return to thine own house, and show what great things God hath done unto thee.” And he went his way, and proclaimed throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that when Jesus had returned, the people gladly received Him, for they were all waiting for Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue. And he fell down at Jesus’ feet and besought Him that He would come into his house,
speaker: Narrator

text: for he had one daughter only, about twelve years of age, and she lay dying. But as He went, the people thronged Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a woman having an issue of blood for twelve years, who had spent all her living upon physicians but could not be healed by any,
speaker: Narrator

text: came behind Him and touched the border of His garment; and immediately her issue of blood was stanched.
