text: Consider the ravens: for they neither sow nor reap, they neither have storehouse nor barn, and God feedeth them. How much more are ye better than the fowls?
speaker: Narrator

text: And which of you by taking thought can add to his stature one cubit?
speaker: Narrator

text: If ye then be not able to do that thing which is least, why take ye thought for the rest?
speaker: Narrator

text: Consider the lilies, how they grow: they toil not, they spin not; and yet I say unto you that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
speaker: Narrator

text: If then God so clothe the grass, which is today in the field and tomorrow is cast into the oven, how much more will He clothe you, O ye of little faith?
speaker: Narrator

text: “And seek ye not what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink, neither be ye of doubting mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all these things do the nations of the world seek after, and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: But rather seek ye the Kingdom of God, and all these things shall be added unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Fear not, little flock, for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the Kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sell what ye have, and give alms. Provide yourselves purses which wax not old, a treasure in the heavens that faileth not, where no thief approacheth, neither moth corrupteth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Let your loins be girded about and your lights burning;
speaker: Narrator

text: and ye yourselves like unto men that wait for their lord when he will return from the wedding, that when he cometh and knocketh, they may open unto him immediately.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are those servants whom the lord, when he cometh, shall find watching. Verily I say unto you, that he shall gird himself and make them to sit down to meat, and will come forth and serve them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he shall come in the second watch, or come in the third watch and find them so, blessed are those servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this know, that if the master of the house had known what hour the thief would come, he would have watched and not have suffered his house to be broken into.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be ye therefore ready also, for the Son of Man cometh at an hour when ye think not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter said unto Him, “Lord, speakest Thou this parable unto us, or even to all?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said, “Who then is that faithful and wise steward, whom his lord shall make ruler over his household, to give them their portion of meat in due season?
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is that servant whom his lord, when he cometh, shall find so doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: In truth I say unto you, that he will make him ruler over all that he hath.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if that servant say in his heart, ‘My lord delayeth his coming,’ and shall begin to beat the menservants and maidens, and to eat and drink and be drunken,
speaker: Narrator

text: the lord of that servant will come in a day when he looketh not for him, and at an hour when he is not aware, and will cut him asunder and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that servant, who knew his lord’s will and prepared not himself, neither did according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he that knew not and committed things worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with few stripes. For unto whomsoever much is given, of him shall much be required; and to whom men have committed much, of him they will ask the more.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am come to send fire on the earth, and what will I, if it be already kindled?
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how I am straitened till it be accomplished!
speaker: Narrator

text: Suppose ye that I have come to give peace on earth? I tell you, nay, but rather division.
speaker: Narrator

text: For from henceforth there shall be five in one house divided: three against two, and two against three.
speaker: Narrator

text: The father shall be divided against the son and the son against the father; the mother against the daughter and the daughter against the mother; the mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law and the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said also to the people, “When ye see a cloud rise out of the west, straightway ye say, ‘There cometh a shower’; and so it is.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when ye see the south wind blow, ye say, ‘There will be heat’; and it cometh to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye hypocrites! Ye can discern the face of the sky and of the earth, but how is it that ye do not discern this time?
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yea, and why even for yourselves judge ye not what is right?
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou goest with thine adversary to the magistrate, as thou art on the way, be diligent that thou mayest be delivered from him, lest he hale thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and the officer cast thee into prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell thee, thou shall not depart thence till thou hast paid the very last mite.”
speaker: Narrator

text: There were present at that season some who told Him of the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answering said unto them, “Suppose ye that these Galileans were sinners above all the other Galileans, because they suffered such things?
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you, nay; but unless ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or those eighteen upon whom the tower of Siloam fell and slew them, think ye that they were sinners above all other men that dwelt in Jerusalem?
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you, nay; but unless ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke also this parable: “A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came and sought fruit thereon, and found none.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said he unto the keeper of his vineyard, ‘Behold, these three years I have come seeking fruit on this fig tree and find none. Cut it down. Why cumbereth it the ground?’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answering said unto him, ‘Lord, let it alone this year also, till I shall dig around it and dung it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if it bear fruit, well; and if not, then after that thou shalt cut it down.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity for eighteen years, and was bowed down and could in no way lift herself up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jesus saw her, He called her to Him and said unto her, “Woman, thou art loosed from thine infirmity.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He laid His hands on her, and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation, because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath day, and said unto the people, “There are six days in which men ought to work; in them therefore come and be healed, and not on the Sabbath day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord then answered him and said, “Thou hypocrite! Doth not each one of you on the Sabbath loose his ox or his ass from the stall and lead him away to watering?
speaker: Narrator

text: And ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan hath bound, lo, these eighteen years, be loosed from this bond on the Sabbath day?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He had said these things, all His adversaries were ashamed; and all the people rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said He, “Unto what is the Kingdom of God like? And unto what shall I compare it?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took and cast into his garden; and it grew and waxed a great tree, and the fowls of the air lodged in the branches of it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And again He said, “Unto what shall I liken the Kingdom of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal until the whole was leavened.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He went through the cities and villages, teaching and journeying toward Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said one unto Him, “Lord, are there few who are saved?” And He said unto them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Strive to enter in at the strait gate, for many, I say unto you, will seek to enter in and shall not be able.
speaker: Narrator

text: When once the master of the house is risen up and hath shut the door, and ye begin to stand outside and to knock at the door, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open unto us,’ and He shall answer and say unto you, ‘I know you not from whence ye are,’
speaker: Narrator

text: then shall ye begin to say, ‘We have eaten and drunk in Thy presence, and Thou hast taught in our streets.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But He shall say, ‘I tell you, I know you not from whence ye are. Depart from Me, all ye workers of iniquity.’
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth when ye shall see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the Kingdom of God, and you yourselves thrust out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall come from the east and from the west, and from the north and from the south, and shall sit down in the Kingdom of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, there are last which shall be first, and there are first which shall be last.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The same day there came certain of the Pharisees, saying unto Him, “Get thee out and depart hence, for Herod will kill thee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “Go ye and tell that fox, ‘Behold, I cast out devils and I do cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I shall be perfected.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless I must walk today and tomorrow and the day following, for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, which killest the prophets and stonest them that are sent unto thee, how often would I have gathered thy children together, as a hen doth gather her brood under her wings, and ye would not!
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate; and verily I say unto you, ye shall not see Me until the time come when ye shall say, ‘Blessed is He that cometh in the name of the Lord.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, as He went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees to eat bread on the Sabbath day, that they watched Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, there was a certain man before Him who had the dropsy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answering, spoke unto the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath day?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they held their peace. And He took him and healed him, and let him go.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He answered them, saying, “Which of you shall have an ox or an ass fallen into a pit, and will not straightway pull him out on the Sabbath day?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And again they could not answer Him concerning these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He put forth a parable to those who were bidden, when He marked how they chose out the chief places, saying unto them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “When thou art bidden by any man to a wedding, sit not down in the highest place, lest a more honorable man than thou be bidden by him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he that bade thee and him come and say to thee, ‘Give this man thy place,’ and thou begin with shame to take the lowest place.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when thou art bidden, go and sit down in the lowest place, that when he that bade thee cometh, he may say unto thee, ‘Friend, go up higher.’ Then shalt thou have honor in the presence of them that sit at meat with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased, and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said He also to him who bade Him, “When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends nor thy brethren, neither thy kinsmen nor thy rich neighbors, lest they also bid thee again and a recompense be made to thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when thou makest a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind,
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou shalt be blessed, for they cannot recompense thee. For thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when one of those who sat at meat with Him heard these things, he said unto Him, “Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the Kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said unto him, “A certain man made a great supper and bade many.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he sent his servant at suppertime to say to them that were bidden, ‘Come, for all things are now ready.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And they all with one accord began to make excuses. The first said unto him, ‘I have bought a piece of ground, and I need to go and see it. I pray thee have me excused.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And another said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I go to test them. I pray thee have me excused.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And another said, ‘I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So that servant came and showed his lord these things. Then the master of the house, being angry, said to his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in hither the poor and the maimed and the halt and the blind.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And the servant said, ‘Lord, it is done as thou hast commanded, and yet there is room.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And the lord said unto the servant, ‘Go out into the highways and hedges and compel them to come in, that my house may be filled.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I say unto you that none of those men who were bidden shall taste of my supper.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And there went great multitudes with Him, and He turned and said unto them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “If any man come to Me and hate not his father and mother, and wife and children, and brethren and sisters, yea, and his own life also, he cannot be My disciple.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whosoever doth not bear his cross and come after Me cannot be My disciple.
speaker: Narrator

text: For which of you, intending to build a tower, sitteth not down first and counteth the cost, whether he have sufficient to finish it?
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest it may happen, after he hath laid the foundation and is not able to finish it, all who behold it begin to mock him,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, ‘This man began to build and was not able to finish.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Or what king, going to make war against another king, sitteth not down first and consulteth whether he be able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sendeth an envoy and desireth conditions of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: So likewise, whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath, he cannot be My disciple.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Salt is good; but if the salt have lost his savor, wherewith shall it be seasoned?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is neither fit for the land, nor yet for the dunghill; but men cast it out. He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then drew near unto Him all the publicans and sinners to hear Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, “This man receiveth sinners and eateth with them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He spoke this parable unto them, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “What man of you, having a hundred sheep, if he lose one of them, doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness, and go after that which is lost until he find it?
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he hath found it, he layeth it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he cometh home, he calleth together his friends and neighbors, saying unto them, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost!’
speaker: Narrator

text: I say unto you that likewise more joy shall be in Heaven over one sinner that repenteth, than over ninety and nine just persons who need no repentance.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Or what woman, having ten pieces of silver, if she lose one piece, doth not light a candle and sweep the house and seek diligently until she find it?
speaker: Narrator

text: And when she hath found it, she calleth her friends and her neighbors together, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the piece which I had lost!’
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise I say unto you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said, “A certain man had two sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the portion of goods that falleth to me.’ And he divided unto them his estate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And not many days after, the younger son gathered all together and took his journey into a far country, and there wasted his substance with riotous living.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had spent all, there arose a mighty famine in that land, and he began to be in want.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country, who sent him into his fields to feed swine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine ate, and no man gave unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he came to himself, he said, ‘How many hired servants of my father’s have bread enough and to spare, and I perish with hunger!
speaker: Narrator

text: I will arise and go to my father and will say unto him, “Father, I have sinned against Heaven and before thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: and am no more worthy to be called thy son. Make me as one of thy hired servants.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he arose and came to his father. But when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him and had compassion, and ran and fell on his neck and kissed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the son said unto him, ‘Father, I have sinned against Heaven and in thy sight, and am no more worthy to be called thy son.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But the father said to his servants, ‘Bring forth the best robe and put it on him, and put a ring on his hand and shoes on his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: And bring hither the fatted calf and kill it, and let us eat and be merry;
speaker: Narrator

text: for this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found.’ And they began to be merry.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now his elder son was in the field; and as he came and drew nigh to the house, he heard music and dancing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called one of the servants and asked what these things meant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto him, ‘Thy brother is come, and thy father hath killed the fatted calf, because he hath received him safe and sound.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was angry and would not go in; therefore came his father out and entreated him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answering said to his father, ‘Lo, these many years have I served thee, neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment; and yet thou never gavest me a kid, that I might make merry with my friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as soon as this thy son was come who hath devoured thy living with harlots, thou hast killed for him the fatted calf.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto him, ‘Son, thou art ever with me, and all that I have is thine.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was meet that we should make merry and be glad; for this thy brother was dead, and is alive again; and was lost, and is found.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said also unto His disciples, “There was a certain rich man who had a steward, and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called him and said unto him, ‘How is it that I hear this of thee? Give an account of thy stewardship, for thou mayest be no longer steward.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the steward said within himself, ‘What shall I do? For my lord taketh away from me the stewardship. I cannot dig; to beg I am ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am resolved what to do, that when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So he called every one of his lord’s debtors unto him, and said unto the first, ‘How much owest thou unto my lord?’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, ‘A hundred measures of oil.’ And he said to him, ‘Take thy bill, and sit down quickly and write fifty.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said he to another, ‘And how much owest thou?’ And he said, ‘A hundred measures of wheat.’ And he said unto him, ‘Take thy bill and write fourscore.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And the lord commended the unjust steward, because he had done wisely; for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I say unto you, make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness, that when ye fail, they may receive you into everlasting habitations.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that is faithful in that which is least, is faithful also in much; and he that is unjust in the least, is unjust also in much.
speaker: Narrator

text: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?
speaker: Narrator

text: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man’s, who shall give you that which is your own?
speaker: Narrator

text: No servant can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will hold to the one and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Pharisees also, who were covetous, heard all these things, and they derided Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “Ye are they who justify yourselves before men, but God knoweth your hearts. For that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Law and the Prophets were until John. Since that time the Kingdom of God is preached, and every man presseth into it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away, than one tittle of the law to fail.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Whosoever putteth away his wife and marrieth another committeth adultery; and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery.
speaker: Narrator

text: “There was a certain rich man, who was clothed in purple and fine linen and fared sumptuously every day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, who was laid at his gate, full of sores
speaker: Narrator

text: and desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man’s table. Moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that the beggar died, and was carried by the angels into Abraham’s bosom. The rich man also died, and was buried.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in hell, being in torment, he lifted up his eyes and saw Abraham afar off and Lazarus in his bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he cried and said, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus that he may dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue; for I am tormented in this flame.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But Abraham said, ‘Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime received thy good things, and likewise Lazarus evil things; but now he is comforted and thou art tormented.
speaker: Narrator

text: And besides all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed, so that they who would pass from here to you cannot; neither can they pass to us, that would come from there.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, ‘I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest send him to my father’s house,
speaker: Narrator

text: for I have five brethren, that he may testify unto them lest they also come into this place of torment.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Abraham said unto him, ‘They have Moses and the prophets; let them hear them.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, ‘Nay, father Abraham; but if one went unto them from the dead, they will repent.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abraham said unto him, ‘If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded though one rose from the dead.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said He unto His disciples, “It is impossible but that offenses will come, but woe unto him through whom they come!
speaker: Narrator

text: It were better for him that a millstone were hung about his neck and he cast into the sea, than that he should cause one of these little ones to fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take heed to yourselves. If thy brother trespass against thee, rebuke him; and if he repent, forgive him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day, and seven times in a day turn again to thee, saying, ‘I repent,’ thou shalt forgive him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the apostles said unto the Lord, “Increase our faith.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said, “If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye might say unto this sycamine tree, ‘Be thou plucked up by the root, and be thou planted in the sea,’ and it should obey you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But which of you, having a servant plowing or feeding cattle, will say unto him by and by when he is come from the field, ‘Go and sit down to meat’?
speaker: Narrator

text: But will you not rather say unto him, ‘Make ready wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself and serve me until I have eaten and drunk, and afterward thou shalt eat and drink’?
speaker: Narrator

text: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him? I think not!
speaker: Narrator

text: So likewise ye, when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you, say, ‘We are unprofitable servants. We have done that which was our duty to do.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass as He went to Jerusalem that He passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as He entered into a certain village, there met Him ten men who were lepers, who stood afar off.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they lifted up their voices and said, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He saw them, He said unto them, “Go, show yourselves unto the priests.” And it came to pass that as they went, they were cleansed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And one of them when he saw that he was healed, turned back and with a loud voice glorified God,
speaker: Narrator

text: and fell down on his face at His feet, giving Him thanks; and he was a Samaritan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answering said, “Were there not ten cleansed? But where are the nine?
speaker: Narrator

text: There are none found that returned to give glory to God, save this stranger.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto him, “Arise; go thy way. Thy faith hath made thee whole.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Pharisees had demanded of Him when the Kingdom of God should come, He answered them and said, “The Kingdom of God cometh not with outward show.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shall they say, ‘Lo, it is here!’ or ‘Lo, it is there!’ For behold, the Kingdom of God is within you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto the disciples, “The days will come when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and ye shall not see it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall say to you, ‘See, here!’ or ‘See, there!’ Go not after them, nor follow them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as the lightning that lighteneth one part under heaven shineth unto the other part under heaven, so shall also the Son of Man be in His day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But first must He suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as it was in the days of Noah, so shall it be also in the days of the Son of Man:
speaker: Narrator

text: They ate, they drank, they married wives, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ark, and the flood came and destroyed them all.

text: And I appoint unto you a Kingdom, as My Father hath appointed unto Me,
speaker: Narrator

text: that ye may eat and drink at My table in My Kingdom, and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said, “Simon, Simon! Behold, Satan hath desired to have you, that he may sift you as wheat.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have prayed for thee, that thy faith fail not; and when thou art converted, strengthen thy brethren.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peter said unto Him, “Lord, I am ready to go with Thee, both into prison and to death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said, “I tell thee, Peter, the cock shall not crow this day before thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “When I sent you without purse and pack and shoes, lacked ye anything?” And they said, “Nothing.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said He unto them, “But now, he that hath a purse, let him take it and likewise his pack; and he that hath no sword, let him sell his garment and buy one.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I say unto you that this that is written must yet be accomplished in Me: ‘And He was reckoned among the transgressors.’ For the things concerning Me have an end.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, “Lord, behold, here are two swords.” And He said unto them, “It is enough.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came out and went, as He was wont, to the Mount of Olives; and His disciples also followed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He was at the place, He said unto them, “Pray that ye enter not into temptation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was withdrawn from them about a stone’s cast, and kneeled down and prayed,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Father, if Thou be willing, remove this cup from Me; nevertheless not My will, but Thine be done.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And there appeared an angel unto Him from Heaven, strengthening Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And being in agony, He prayed more earnestly, and His sweat was, as it were, great drops of blood falling down to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He rose up from prayer and had come to His disciples, He found them sleeping for sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “Why sleep ye? Rise and pray, lest ye enter into temptation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And while He yet spoke, behold, a multitude; and he that was called Judas, one of the twelve, went before them and drew near unto Jesus to kiss Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said unto him, “Judas, betrayest thou the Son of Man with a kiss?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When those who were about Him saw what would follow, they said unto Him, “Lord, shall we smite with the sword?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And one of them smote the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered and said, “Suffer ye thus far.” And He touched his ear and healed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said unto the chief priests and captains of the temple and the elders, who had come to Him, “Have ye come out as against a thief, with swords and staves?
speaker: Narrator

text: When I was daily with you in the temple, ye stretched forth no hands against Me; but this is your hour, and the power of darkness.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they took Him and led Him, and brought Him into the high priest’s house. And Peter followed afar off.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall and had sat down together, Peter sat down among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire, and earnestly looked upon him and said, “This man was also with him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he denied Him, saying, “Woman, I know Him not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And after a little while another saw him and said, “Thou art also of them.” And Peter said, “Man, I am not!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And after the space of about an hour, another confidently affirmed, saying, “In truth this fellow also was with him, for he is a Galilean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peter said, “Man, I know not what thou sayest!” And immediately, while he yet spoke, the cock crowed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord turned and looked upon Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how He had said unto him, “Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny Me thrice.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peter went out and wept bitterly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men who held Jesus mocked Him and smote Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had blindfolded Him, they struck Him on the face and asked Him, saying, “Prophesy! Who is it that smote thee?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And many other things they spoke blasphemously against Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as soon as it was day, the elders of the people and the chief priests and the scribes came together, and led Him into their council, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Art thou the Christ? Tell us.” And He said unto them, “If I tell you, ye will not believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if I also ask you, ye will not answer Me nor let Me go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hereafter shall the Son of Man sit on the right hand of the power of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said they all, “Art thou then the Son of God?” And He said unto them, “Ye say that I am.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, “What need we any further witness? For we ourselves have heard it from his own mouth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the whole multitude of them arose and led Him unto Pilate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they began to accuse Him, saying, “We found this fellow perverting the nation and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar, saying that he himself is Christ, a king.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate asked Him, saying, “Art thou the king of the Jews?” And He answered him and said, “Thou sayest it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Pilate to the chief priests and the people, “I find no fault in this man.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they became the more fierce, saying, “He stirreth up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee to this place.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked whether the Man were a Galilean.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as soon as he learned that He belonged unto Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent Him to Herod, who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Herod saw Jesus he was exceedingly glad, for he had been desirous to see Him for a long time, because he had heard many things about Him, and he hoped to see some miracle done by Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he questioned Him with many words, but He answered him nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Herod, with his men of war, treated Him with contempt and mocked Him, and arrayed Him in a gorgeous robe and sent Him again to Pilate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the same day, Pilate and Herod were made friends together, for before that there was enmity between them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: said unto them, “Ye have brought this man unto me as one who perverteth the people. And behold, I, having examined him before you, have found no fault in this man concerning those things whereof ye accuse him.
speaker: Narrator

text: No, nor yet Herod; for I sent you to him, and lo, nothing worthy of death is done unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will therefore chastise him and release him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: (For of necessity he must release one unto them at the Feast.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And they all cried out at once, saying, “Away with this man, and release unto us Barabbas”
speaker: Narrator

text: (who had been cast into prison for a certain sedition made in the city, and for murder).
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate therefore, desiring to release Jesus, spoke again to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they cried, saying, “Crucify him, crucify him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them the third time, “Why? What evil hath he done? I have found no cause for death in him. I will therefore chastise him and let him go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they were instant with loud voices, requiring that He might be crucified. And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he released unto them the one who for sedition and murder had been cast into prison, whom they had desired; but he delivered Jesus to their will.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they led Him away, they laid hold upon one Simon, a Cyrenian, coming out of the country, and on him they laid the cross, that he might bear it after Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there followed Him a great company of people, and of women who also bewailed and lamented Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, turning unto them, said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for Me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.
speaker: Narrator

text: For behold, the days are coming in which they shall say, ‘Blessed are the barren, and the wombs that never bore and the breasts which never gave suck.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and to the hills, ‘Cover us!’
speaker: Narrator

text: For if they do these things in a green tree, what shall be done in the dry?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And there were also two others, malefactors, led with Him to be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had come to the place which is called Calvary, there they crucified Him, and the malefactors, one on the right hand and the other on the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they know not what they do.” And they parted His raiment and cast lots.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people stood beholding. And the rulers who were also with them derided Him, saying, “He saved others; let him save himself if he be Christ, the chosen of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the soldiers also mocked Him, coming to Him and offering Him vinegar
speaker: Narrator

text: and saying, “If thou art the king of the Jews, save thyself.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And a superscription also was written over Him in letters of Greek and Latin and Hebrew: This Is The King Of The Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: And one of the malefactors who was hanged railed against Him, saying, “If thou be Christ, save thyself and us!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the other answering rebuked him, saying, “Dost not thou fear God, seeing thou art under the same condemnation?
speaker: Narrator

text: And we indeed justly, for we receive the due reward of our deeds. But this Man hath done nothing amiss.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto Jesus, “Lord, remember me when Thou comest into Thy Kingdom.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said unto him, “Verily I say unto thee, today shalt thou be with Me in Paradise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was about the sixth hour, and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jesus had cried out with a loud voice, He said, “Father, into Thy hands I commend My spirit.” And having said thus, He gave up the ghost.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the centurion saw what was done, he glorifed God, saying, “Certainly this was a righteous man!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people who came together to that sight, beholding the things which had been done, smote their breasts and returned.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all His acquaintances and the women who had followed Him from Galilee stood afar off, beholding these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, there was a man named Joseph, a council member, and he was a good man and a just.
speaker: Narrator

text: (The same had not consented to their counsel and deed.) He was of Arimathea, a city of the Jews, who himself also waited for the Kingdom of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: This man went unto Pilate and begged the body of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took it down and wrapped it in linen, and laid it in a sepulcher that was hewn in stone, wherein never man before was laid.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that day was the Preparation, and the Sabbath drew near.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the women also, who came with Him from Galilee, followed after, and beheld the sepulcher and how His body was laid.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they returned and prepared spices and ointments, and rested the Sabbath day according to the commandment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now upon the first day of the week very early in the morning, they came unto the sepulcher, bringing the spices which they had prepared; and certain others were with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulcher.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they entered in and found not the body of the Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, as they were much perplexed about this, behold, two men stood by them in shining garments.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they were afraid and bowed down their faces to the earth, they said unto them, “Why seek ye the living among the dead?
speaker: Narrator

text: He is not here, but is risen! Remember how He spoke unto you when He was yet in Galilee,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, ‘The Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men and be crucified, and the third day rise again.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they remembered His words,
speaker: Narrator

text: and returned from the sepulcher and told all these things unto the eleven and to all the rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was Mary Magdalene and Joanna and Mary the mother of James, and other women who were with them, who told these things unto the apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their words seemed to them as idle tales, and they believed them not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then arose Peter and ran unto the sepulcher; and stooping down, he beheld the linen cloths laid by themselves. And he departed, wondering to himself at that which had come to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, two of them were going that same day to a village called Emmaus, which was from Jerusalem about seven miles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they talked together of all these things which had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass that while they communed and reasoned together, Jesus Himself drew near and went with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But their eyes were held, that they should not know Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “What manner of communications are these that ye have one to another as ye walk and are sad?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And one of them, whose name was Cleopas, answering said unto Him, “Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem, and hast not known the things which have come to pass there in these days?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “What things?” And they said unto Him, “Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, who was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people;
speaker: Narrator

text: and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered Him to be condemned to death and have crucified Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we trusted that it had been He who should have redeemed Israel. And besides all this, today is the third day since these things were done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, and certain women also of our company, who were early at the sepulcher, made us astonished.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they found not His body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels, who said that He was alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: And certain of those who were with us went to the sepulcher and found it even so as the women had said, but Him they saw not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said unto them, “O fools, and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken!
speaker: Narrator

text: Ought not Christ to have suffered these things and to enter into His glory?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And beginning with Moses and all the prophets, He expounded unto them in all the Scriptures the things concerning Himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they drew nigh unto the village whither they were going, and He made as though He would have gone further.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they constrained Him, saying, “Abide with us, for it is toward evening and the day is far spent.” And He went in to tarry with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, as He sat at meat with them, He took bread and blessed it, and broke and gave it to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their eyes were opened and they knew Him. And He vanished out of their sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said to one another, “Did not our hearts burn within us while He talked with us on the way and while He opened to us the Scriptures?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they rose up that same hour and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together and those who were with them,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “The Lord is risen indeed and hath appeared to Simon!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they told what things were done on the way, and how He was known to them in the breaking of bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they thus spoke, Jesus Himself stood in the midst of them and said unto them, “Peace be unto you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they were terrified and afraid, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “Why are ye troubled, and why do thoughts arise in your hearts?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold My hands and My feet, that it is I Myself. Handle Me and see, for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye see Me to have.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He had thus spoken, He showed them His hands and His feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: And while they yet believed not for joy, and wondered, He said unto them, “Have ye here any meat?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they gave Him a piece of a broiled fish and of a honeycomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He took it and ate before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “These are the words which I spoke unto you while I was yet with you, that all things must be fulfilled which were written in the Law of Moses and in the Prophets and in the Psalms concerning Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then opened He their understanding, that they might understand the Scriptures,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said unto them, “Thus it is written, and thus it behooved Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in His name among all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye are witnesses of these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, I send the promise of My Father upon you; but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem until ye be endued with power from on high.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He led them out as far as to Bethany, and He lifted up His hands and blessed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, while He blessed them, He was parted from them and carried up into Heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they worshiped Him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,
speaker: Narrator

text: and were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
